content:
I assume this will cause at least one nonpredicted bit of fallout, so FYI everyone.

Do ping me if you hit things, and I'll attempt to help where I can.

(There's also a bunch of predicted fallout, like the â‰ˆ624 crates using rocket 0.4.*.)

656 of the 747 regressions are things trying to implement or use Try, often via older versions of rocket

Note that rocket 0.4.x is not an older version, its actually the latest release. It's just that rocket on master is async and compiles on stable so many users use that instead.
Hm, that's concerning, but hopefully there's a point release there soon. Likely would've been good to coordinate a bit more before merging...

Rocket has been able to compile with stable rust since July 2020 <https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/issues/19#issuecomment-662163818> and Sergio Benitez commented on the RFC <https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3058#issuecomment-796417876>, so I didn't think this would be a surprise to people :/
I don't think it's a problem, but afaict it's not quite true that it compiles on stable, right? 0.4.x hasn't released (and won't?) with a version supporting stable, afaict
Doh! I made a PR <https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/pull/1643>, but Sergio beat me with <https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/commit/425f741b873424046e20855f3fe13a3eb01b0c5e>
